headline: 'The Five' on Democrats' fleeing Texas, Biden's speech

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Judge Jeanine Pirro, Harold Ford, Jr., Dana Perino and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City and this is THE FIVE. A huge battle over voting taking center stage in America. A fearmongering Joe Biden smearing Republicans as racist and claiming democracy in America is under siege over states like Texas trying to pass election integrity laws.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: The 21st century Jim Crow assault is real. It's unrelenting. And we are going to challenge it vigorously. Are you on the side of truth or lies? Fact or fiction? Justice or injustice? Democracy or autocracy? That's what it's coming down to. Stand up, for god sake, and help prevent this concerted effort to undermine our election and the sacred right to vote. Have you no shame? We are facing the most significant test of our democracy since the civil war.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden is also calling for a federal takeover of elections and is promising to use his Department of Justice to go after the states. Now, keep in mind, that while the president spews that kind of rhetoric, liberal fact-checkers have found these Republican bills actually expand voting hours. But those facts don't matter to liberals in Texas. A group of showboating Democrats just skipping town in order to block Republicans there from passing these new voting bills. They are fashioning themselves as political martyrs, who of course fled to Washington, D.C. on a pair of private jets without face masks and a case of beer. And while these Democrats soak up attention, Texas Governor Greg Abbott is promising to arrest them when they return.

utterances.speaker: GREG ABBOTT (R), GOVERNOR OF TEXAS
utterances.sentences: That is not the way that Texas -- Texans do things. I will continue calling special session after special session because overtime is going to continue until they step up to vote. Once they step back into the state of Texas, they will be arrested and brought to the Texas capitol and we will be conducting business.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So, Greg, do you think they're going to slap the cuffs on these fleeing Democrats or not?

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: You know, at first -- I was going to talk about that but -- what Joe said today just upsets me. I mean, he is a pathological, shameless liar. He ran on being a unifier and all he does his bank on racial discontent, right? He is like comparing this bill to the KKK and to Jim Crow. It's like all he does is foment racial conflict and he's making -- he claims that he's making a moral case for voting rights as if there are no voting rights. Every American has the right to vote, except the less favored voting blocs, which are violent felons, illegal immigrants, and the dead. My theory is there is only one possibility of a true zombie uprising, and it's as if corpses found out that they were voting for Joe Biden. The only Republicans Democrats know of are evil. It started with Ronald Reagan. Ronald Reagan was supposed be the worst, right? He was Hitler. Then you got George Bush. He was, you know, a warmonger. Then you had the other George Bush, he was a warmonger. Then you had John McCain, warmonger. They you had Mitt Romney who was going to put everybody back in chains, right? Then we are supposed to get the biggest, greatest existential risk in history out of Donald Trump, and now we're sold -- that's a lie because he's gone, and now this is a bigger existential risk than Donald Trump. This is the worst thing since the civil war. I'm beginning to think they are exaggerating.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What gives you that idea?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know! I'm just looking forward to the next existential risk.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Judge Jeanine, I looked through the entire Texas voting bill today and there is not one thing in there that restricts voting. Not one thing.

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: There isn't one thing in there that restricts voting. And if you'll think about it, they even brought one person before you to tell you that this person was not able to vote because of this. In fact, what they want to do is remember when they expanded everything because it was the pandemic. They want to expand the pandemic. They want to keep the pandemic voting and they want to expand that. And you know what really makes me crazy? What makes me crazy is you have these Texas legislators who make a decision that they're going to go to Washington, D.C. I mean, it's such an embarrassment to Texans. I mean, I know a lot of people from Texas. I love a lot of people in Texas, okay? The one thing they don't do is cut and run. The one thing they don't do is run to daddy in Washington and say, "Daddy, help us. We don't want to do our job. We want to federalize the election law." who gave you that right? Get back to work. People voted for you to work on legislation. You tried to stop the regular session. They couldn't get anything pass. They know how to do it. And now they are doing it for the special sessions. These people are an embarrassment. Look at them, they look like they're going to camp. I guarantee you there is Miller Lite on that plane.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There is Miller Lite because they probably had to pay for that. They didn't have to pay for the plane. So they got a chartered plane, but when they had to buy the beer, oh, Miller Lite.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So who paid for the plane? Who paid for the plane?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Obviously, the taxpayers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, so how does it look right now, the Democrats fleeing to Washington? And I believe Kamala Harris is going to be meeting with these fleeing Democrats. I don't know when, but we will cover it here on the show. They can't look --

utterances.speaker: HAROLD FORD, JR., FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I don't know who paid for that plane (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Soros.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Soros fly the jet.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: I think -- when you think about -- Judge, I think you raised an excellent points and everyone's raised the right points around --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, I like you. This is the first time we've been together.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Keep your hands off him.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We've had that problem before.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: I think fundamentally, were' having --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: We have to ask the question, what is -- what do we want when we have an election? Now, to your point, during the pandemic we made accommodations to make it easier for people to vote. I happen to think what you want in any election and I've ran in five elections -- six, I lost one. I wish we could have come back and found more people to vote and make some of the claims that former President Trump is making, but I lost the election. I wanted more people to vote and they didn't. More people voted this time and it just turns out that the Democrats won this time. Now, if we have a set of systems in place to create that and to encourage that and to validated that going forward, I think we should. Now, politics is too much theater. Traveling to D.C., I get the politics, I get the theater of the politics. We all engage in a little of that to make our point. But I'll remind everybody, 60 federal and state courts denied these claims. There has been more scrutiny around this presidential race. Look, the guy that I wanted to win won and I'm thankful. Had he lost, I would have accepted it and moved on. I think at some point, the body politic needs to accept that there was an election, President Biden won, and if we are serious about more people voting, let's put efforts forward and changes to election laws that allow more people to vote and not make it harder for people to vote. And when the Democrats are right or wrong is making it harder.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What people --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: They believe -- they believe they are making it harder for people to vote.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Harold, let me ask you a specific question.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Where in the Texas bill does it make it harder for people to vote?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: So, I'd say two things, Jesse, to answer your question. Number one, we roll back some of the pandemic accommodations that were made to help more people to make it easier to vote.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like what? Like what? What are they rolling back and what does it do to make it harder for people to vote in Texas?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Like 24-hour voting in Houston. It wasn't supposed to be allowed and they did it.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: So, there's (inaudible). Look, I know, we can go with line by line on the bill, but there is no doubt there are efforts that are different for the 2022 and 2024 election if this passes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But actually if it is -- so, if you're saying the rolling back, that's actually not true --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- because they are adding more time to vote. Maybe they took away the 24-hour rule --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, they took away a temporary thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But the things is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- but they are adding way more hours on early voting.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, the thing is also, like I think we're also -- I think -- I'm not saying it's not a serious topic, but I think it's actually, this is to be ridiculed and laughed at. Because, okay, if nothing passes, the state reverts back to pre-2020, okay. And so, if that's the case --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Somebody read the packet!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- then the Democrats are actually for restrictions because it would be pre-2020. There actually are new things in here. Another point, the Supreme Court just ruled -- was it last week or the week before -- that not a single person could be shown to have been harmed in Arizona when it came to voting restrictions. And so the Supreme Court said no, if you can't show somebody, actual person has been harmed --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Who couldn't vote?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- then you can't and that was your point there.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But also, the Texas Democrats really didn't think this through. They made arrangements for private jets, hotel rooms, they scheduled their T.V. interviews, but they did not have a communications meeting. They have simply no message at all. So they end up doing step one, get on a plane, get some beer, take a lot of selfies. Step two, leave that blank, let's fill that in later, and step three, win the fight. They are trying to play power politics with no power.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No power.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: There is no strategy. They need a Mitch McConnell who can calmly say, "This is the goal that we want to get to. This is what we're going to be able to do." And then you message it and work backwards. Now these guys are going to have to know like, "Well, we're going to stay in D.C. for an indeterminate period. Oh, please send more money so that we can stay in the hotels." And they're definitely making money off of this. They are fund- raising like crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Where are their masks?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: For 26 days.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Where are their masks?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Not only that, but they're going to be there for 26 days.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And that's -- because that's when this special session is ending. They're not going back before -- who is paying for this hotel? Democrat socialists of America?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, Harold! Yes!

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's a question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That was a question.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: I'm for more people voting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm for less people voting!

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. We're just for no --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Joking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: UP next, the big city police chief tearing into the left's anti- cop rhetoric after a 3-year-old was shot. You don't want to miss what he said next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Minneapolis police chief tearing into the left's anti-cop rhetoric after a 3-year-old was shot in his city and he says the biggest threat to the black community is not the police.

utterances.speaker: MEDARIA ARRADONDO, MINNEAPOLIS POLICE CHIEF
utterances.sentences: The biggest threat to public safety in our city, and particularly the African-American community, is not the police. It is not the police. We have an epidemic right now of unequivocal gun violence, particularly in the African-American communities and that must stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That comes as President Biden admits Democrats are wrong on defunding the police after telling big city leaders and law enforcement officials to use COVID cash to hire more cops. Dana, you are the first person, I believe, to bring this up to me about this kind of like transfer of money from one thing to another. What is so odd about it? What irks you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What irks me is, okay, so on defund the police you had certain precincts. Let's just take Minneapolis for example. The local city council decided to defund the police. There are consequences for that, you are seeing them now. So, the president's answer on this has been, okay, well, because we have all this COVID relief money slushing (ph) around, just use that. SO you have local taxpayers being represented by local government making decisions that affect their local community. And then the federal taxpayer --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- through COVID relief funds has to bail it out? I don't think that makes any sense and I don't think we should sleep on it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There you go. What should we do?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Should we -- should we nap on it? Let's nap on it, have a snack, and come back to it later. All right, Judge, I have this amazing ironic theory.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The greatest irony of all is that the left got what they wanted. They got a handicapped police, right, and they got some defunding, they got all this anti-cop rhetoric out there. And now what they got in return is the death of gun control. You cannot have an argument about gun control as you have leftists buying guns. The eight million guns from last year, they are finding in a survey are a lot of liberals are buying guns.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Look, gun sales are through the roof for one reason. People aren't stupid. They know that when they call 911 that maybe 911 ain't coming. They've got to defend themselves. We saw it last weekend. There were several killings. One I think by a 12-year-old defending his mother, another an 80-year-old woman when a guy came into her house. People who have and buy guns legally know they have to learn how to use a gun, so they can shoot and kill. What's going on in the streets of Chicago and everywhere else are just a bunch of thugs shooting. They've never been to a gun range. I mean, they just shoot in the hood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are you advising they do go to the gun range?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: They just take it out of out of their waistband and shoot in the hood, all right? And that's why now you're seeing Americans get it. They know. And by the way, the biggest epidemic in this country, it's not COVID, it's not climate change. It's not all this other stuff. It is criminals in the United States walking free after they are shooting innocent victims. It's happening in a way that we haven't seen since the '70s and it is skyrocketing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Harold, why do you love criminals?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: I was waiting for that question, Greg.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Look, that Minneapolis police chief is really -- he's been consistent throughout all of this. And he was amongst a number of Democrats that for a long time have said we can't defund the police. I've said on this show, I said it from the outset, I got beat up a little bit for saying anyone who doesn't want police in their neighborhood, just send them to my neighborhood. And frankly, every other neighborhood in the country. And I live in a neighborhood that I'm fortunate to live in. I don't know of any neighborhood in America that does not want police there. Two, defund, I mean, this bail reform, judge, you are right. Those were -- they were well-intentioned people wanting some form of bail reform, but it has gone awry and it's not -- whatever the good intentions were, they have completely missed the point here and you're putting criminals and violent people back out on the streets. We got to change that. Three, I'm still a believer in the ghost guns. Trey Gowdy and I, we were on last night, Jesse and I were on Brett's show last night talking a little bit about this. You've got to increase the prosecutions of people who have guns illegally. But at the same time you have to ask the question, and you got on me by talking about fresh apples last week, people, some of these kids can get fresh apples but they can get guns. How do they get the guns? If you can't -- if a criminal can't walk into a gun show or gun store and buy it, it seems strange to me these kids have been flood into their community. So, let's go after the bad guys who are flooding it to the communities, guns into these communities, and go after these kids, these thugs and these criminals. Not just kids, any age person committing violent acts in communities, and then let's stop them from getting out of jail and I would agree with you.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but gun trafficking and prosecuting gun trafficking is nothing new. We've been doing it for years. The prosecutors are not doing it now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Something else changed.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's the problem.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: But prior to the pandemic, Chicago had these issues before. Prior to President Trump raising these issues about gun violence in Chicago, it has existed. We also had Democratic mayors who oversaw cities where crime was coming down. A number of reasons, number of factors and we can debate that later, but I think we go after those who are flooding communities with guns also.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, nothing to debate in Chicago. They were one of the lowest in terms of prosecuting gun trafficking in the country.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: I would agree. That needs to change.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, Jesse, this is like age-old lesson that you don't know what you have until it's gone. And we notice that that people like the squad or the loudest defunders.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you think they've learned a lesson?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The defund the police movement disappeared faster than occupy Wall Street. Where they go? I don't hear them chanting. They're not booked on CNN anymore and that's because the defund the police movement caused black lives. And all the people in the media that sponsored it have to live with that. Do you remember in 2020, the people that were pushing defund the police? Who was it? It was the professional black activist class, academic revolutionaries. It was the squad and it was local city council members. Who wasn't on that list? It wasn't your mom and your dad in the black community that struggles with violence. This was not a movement for the people because the people in these neighborhoods know you have to have fast 911 response times. So it took Al Sharpton, who is supposed to represent black America, until September to come out and say that defund the police is something that a latte liberal would support. It took CNN until August to come and say after the polling switch, "Hey, maybe this isn't such a good idea." So, you said, public safety is so fragile. And the minute you pull back and start acting permissive, you get a crime wave and now we are living in the results of that.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: In fairness to Sharpton, he came out a little sooner, but there is no doubt, there were certainly should've been more voices as well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. And remember, when we brought up defunding, the other networks were saying no, it's not defunding. They're just -- it's diverting. Remember the diverting?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Re-imagining.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes. It's not really what it is! CNN still got to answer for that one. And the socialist speak, Bernie Sanders bashes America after the crackdown in communist China.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Socialist darling Bernie Sanders finally breaking his silence on Cuba. And of course he's taking a shot at America. Bernie going soft on the communist regime when pressed on it.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Last year during the campaign you said that it's unfair to simply say everything is bad in Cuba. Do you still share that sentiment now that the people there seem to be --

utterances.speaker: SNE. BERNIE SANDERS (I-VT)
utterances.sentences: Well, I support throughout Latin America and in Cuba and every place else, the right of people to protest for a decent economy and for political freedom.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And Bernie's response wouldn't be complete without blaming America, instead of decades of a communist dictatorship. He tweeted this, "It's also long past time to end the unilateral U.S. embargo on Cuba, which has only hurt, not helped, the Cuban people." Okay, I'll go to you, Greg. Okay, talk about the fact that the people in Cuba who are protesting allegedly are protesting over COVID, according to the Cuban --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Cuban -- what is it?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.sentences: Services?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: The services, whatever, the government. Is it really about COVID?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, of course not. COVID just brings out the worst in a doomed society. But for Sanders, it's hard to condemn something or an idea that you've praised for almost your entire life. It goes back to the enemy of intellectual growth, which is the sunk cost. If you've invested 70 years of your life in an idea that destroys entities once they adopt it, it's kind of hard. It's a little late for Bernie to turn that truck around. I mean, it is the ideological equivalent of a money pit. You can't stop putting money to it. Bernie denouncing Cuba would be like CNN denouncing fake news. That's your brand. Jesse denouncing hair gel, you know, Dana denouncing Jasper, me denouncing raw sensuality.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That was a great answer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right. You know, the Democratic Socialists of America seem to be backing, you know, the claim that they are over there not protesting about freedom, but they are protesting about other things like the economy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, then they should take Spanish class, because libertad, which is what they are all clamoring for means liberty and freedom, and that's what they are asking for. Actually, if you do just a little bit of research on it for those socialists out there, you can see that it was really from the grassroots and it really show with a lot of artist including a rap artist who was like, "I'm just going to go forward" because they are sick of it. They are tired of it and they want the help. And I don't think that -- well, the good news is for the Cubans, that Bernie is not Biden and Biden is the president of the United States. I don't think that Biden is exactly where Obama was on this. Remember, Obama went like full normalize relations and the embargo, do all these things. President Trump walks it back. I don't think Biden will actually go back to the Obama version because one, they saw what happened when they squashed or didn't help the revolution in Iran. And they don't want that to happen here in Cuba. Like you can't do that to people there. The discouraging thing is that the internet has been shut down and communication has kind of stopped there, so if there's anyone out there that has the technology that would allow these people to be able to communicate with each other, it's good. The other bad news is apparently a lot of these dissidents that were jailed are being treated terribly and there ought to be consequences for that, too.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, Jesse, it's true. They are being treated terribly. And we just found out that there are more than 100 missing or arrested and one included a journalist. You know, what should we be doing in this situation?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, we don't have a great track record of dealing with that regime, so I don't know what we could do. And every attempt we've made to overthrow that regime has backfired. So, I think this might be a time where you want to wait it out. But I want to talk about Bernie Sanders here. Just a little history lesson. The reason we have the embargo against Cuba is because the Soviets put missiles in Cuba, ballistic missiles pointed at the United States. They're 90 miles off the shore of Key West. He just think that's OK. Like, let's just drop the embargo, and all of the enemies of America just send missiles to Cuba and point it at Washington D.C. That's why Bernie Sanders is dangerously stupid. Does Bernie really believe that communism would work if we just dropped the embargo? No, the regime is just going to pilfer all the stuff. And they're going to basically use patronage to set up a permanent and never-ending authoritarian regime. Here's what Bernie, and this is to Greg's point here, here's what Bernie is saying. He never actually addresses the fact that people in these communist countries hated their suffering. He never talks about that. He always talks about theoretical communism and theoretical socialism. And that's because he's arrogant. And he believes that communism or socialism would work in this country. And people would like it if just Bernie Sanders could administer it. And that's the fallacy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. And he actually said it was working in Venezuela until it wasn't. Then he had to take it off the Senate Web site. But what about the Squad? The Squad is kind of quiet on this one.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.sentences: I can't speak for him. I don't know why. I have not been, President Biden has not been. I agree with everything that's been said. And there's no excuse. You have a decaying, corrupt and communist regime 90 miles off our shore. I think at some level, we got to step back and even ponder that question a bit. But anybody in their right mind can't support what's happening there and has to be supportive to these protesters. To Jesse's point, it may take -- this could be one of those tipping point moments where the people decide they want this. And I think we'd have to decide how we want to be helpful if we could, and if we could be constructive in helping. Finally, if you look at the entire region, right, you look at our entire hemisphere, one of the reasons I believe as much as we spend money in other hemispheres around the globe to try to stabilize things than we should, we spend very little here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's s true.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.sentences: And we have to think about -- think about that in a meaningful way. Take Bernie out of it, take the squat out of it, think about it from a foreign policy and national security standpoint.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's a great point. It really is.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know about you but it's getting really hot in here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We'll leave you guys alone.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Coming up, Big Brother on steroids. President Biden is being pressured to read your text messages.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.

utterances.utterance: Obviously, the taxpayers.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, so how does it look right now, the Democrats fleeing to Washington? And I believe Kamala Harris is going to be meeting with these fleeing Democrats. I don't know when, but we will cover it here on the show. They can't look --

utterances.speaker: HAROLD FORD, JR., FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I don't know who paid for that plane (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Soros.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Soros fly the jet.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: I think -- when you think about -- Judge, I think you raised an excellent points and everyone's raised the right points around --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, I like you. This is the first time we've been together.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Keep your hands off him.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We've had that problem before.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: I think fundamentally, were' having --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: We have to ask the question, what is -- what do we want when we have an election? Now, to your point, during the pandemic we made accommodations to make it easier for people to vote. I happen to think what you want in any election and I've ran in five elections -- six, I lost one. I wish we could have come back and found more people to vote and make some of the claims that former President Trump is making, but I lost the election. I wanted more people to vote and they didn't. More people voted this time and it just turns out that the Democrats won this time. Now, if we have a set of systems in place to create that and to encourage that and to validated that going forward, I think we should. Now, politics is too much theater. Traveling to D.C., I get the politics, I get the theater of the politics. We all engage in a little of that to make our point. But I'll remind everybody, 60 federal and state courts denied these claims. There has been more scrutiny around this presidential race. Look, the guy that I wanted to win won and I'm thankful. Had he lost, I would have accepted it and moved on. I think at some point, the body politic needs to accept that there was an election, President Biden won, and if we are serious about more people voting, let's put efforts forward and changes to election laws that allow more people to vote and not make it harder for people to vote. And when the Democrats are right or wrong is making it harder.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What people --

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: They believe -- they believe they are making it harder for people to vote.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Harold, let me ask you a specific question.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Where in the Texas bill does it make it harder for people to vote?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: So, I'd say two things, Jesse, to answer your question. Number one, we roll back some of the pandemic accommodations that were made to help more people to make it easier to vote.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like what? Like what? What are they rolling back and what does it do to make it harder for people to vote in Texas?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Like 24-hour voting in Houston. It wasn't supposed to be allowed and they did it.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: So, there's (inaudible). Look, I know, we can go with line by line on the bill, but there is no doubt there are efforts that are different for the 2022 and 2024 election if this passes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But actually if it is -- so, if you're saying the rolling back, that's actually not true --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- because they are adding more time to vote. Maybe they took away the 24-hour rule --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, they took away a temporary thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But the things is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- but they are adding way more hours on early voting.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, the thing is also, like I think we're also -- I think -- I'm not saying it's not a serious topic, but I think it's actually, this is to be ridiculed and laughed at. Because, okay, if nothing passes, the state reverts back to pre-2020, okay. And so, if that's the case --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Somebody read the packet!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- then the Democrats are actually for restrictions because it would be pre-2020. There actually are new things in here. Another point, the Supreme Court just ruled -- was it last week or the week before -- that not a single person could be shown to have been harmed in Arizona when it came to voting restrictions. And so the Supreme Court said no, if you can't show somebody, actual person has been harmed --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Who couldn't vote?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- then you can't and that was your point there.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But also, the Texas Democrats really didn't think this through. They made arrangements for private jets, hotel rooms, they scheduled their T.V. interviews, but they did not have a communications meeting. They have simply no message at all. So they end up doing step one, get on a plane, get some beer, take a lot of selfies. Step two, leave that blank, let's fill that in later, and step three, win the fight. They are trying to play power politics with no power.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No power.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There is no strategy. They need a Mitch McConnell who can calmly say, "This is the goal that we want to get to. This is what we're going to be able to do." And then you message it and work backwards. Now these guys are going to have to know like, "Well, we're going to stay in D.C. for an indeterminate period. Oh, please send more money so that we can stay in the hotels." And they're definitely making money off of this. They are fund- raising like crazy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Where are their masks?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: For 26 days.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Where are their masks?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Not only that, but they're going to be there for 26 days.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And that's -- because that's when this special session is ending. They're not going back before -- who is paying for this hotel? Democrat socialists of America?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, Harold! Yes!

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's a question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That was a question.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: I'm for more people voting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm for less people voting!

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. We're just for no --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Joking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: UP next, the big city police chief tearing into the left's anti- cop rhetoric after a 3-year-old was shot. You don't want to miss what he said next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Minneapolis police chief tearing into the left's anti-cop rhetoric after a 3-year-old was shot in his city and he says the biggest threat to the black community is not the police.

utterances.speaker: MEDARIA ARRADONDO, MINNEAPOLIS POLICE CHIEF
utterances.utterance: The biggest threat to public safety in our city, and particularly the African-American community, is not the police. It is not the police. We have an epidemic right now of unequivocal gun violence, particularly in the African-American communities and that must stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That comes as President Biden admits Democrats are wrong on defunding the police after telling big city leaders and law enforcement officials to use COVID cash to hire more cops. Dana, you are the first person, I believe, to bring this up to me about this kind of like transfer of money from one thing to another. What is so odd about it? What irks you?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What irks me is, okay, so on defund the police you had certain precincts. Let's just take Minneapolis for example. The local city council decided to defund the police. There are consequences for that, you are seeing them now. So, the president's answer on this has been, okay, well, because we have all this COVID relief money slushing (ph) around, just use that. SO you have local taxpayers being represented by local government making decisions that affect their local community. And then the federal taxpayer --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- through COVID relief funds has to bail it out? I don't think that makes any sense and I don't think we should sleep on it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go. What should we do?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Should we -- should we nap on it? Let's nap on it, have a snack, and come back to it later. All right, Judge, I have this amazing ironic theory.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The greatest irony of all is that the left got what they wanted. They got a handicapped police, right, and they got some defunding, they got all this anti-cop rhetoric out there. And now what they got in return is the death of gun control. You cannot have an argument about gun control as you have leftists buying guns. The eight million guns from last year, they are finding in a survey are a lot of liberals are buying guns.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Look, gun sales are through the roof for one reason. People aren't stupid. They know that when they call 911 that maybe 911 ain't coming. They've got to defend themselves. We saw it last weekend. There were several killings. One I think by a 12-year-old defending his mother, another an 80-year-old woman when a guy came into her house. People who have and buy guns legally know they have to learn how to use a gun, so they can shoot and kill. What's going on in the streets of Chicago and everywhere else are just a bunch of thugs shooting. They've never been to a gun range. I mean, they just shoot in the hood.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are you advising they do go to the gun range?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: They just take it out of out of their waistband and shoot in the hood, all right? And that's why now you're seeing Americans get it. They know. And by the way, the biggest epidemic in this country, it's not COVID, it's not climate change. It's not all this other stuff. It is criminals in the United States walking free after they are shooting innocent victims. It's happening in a way that we haven't seen since the '70s and it is skyrocketing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Harold, why do you love criminals?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: I was waiting for that question, Greg.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Look, that Minneapolis police chief is really -- he's been consistent throughout all of this. And he was amongst a number of Democrats that for a long time have said we can't defund the police. I've said on this show, I said it from the outset, I got beat up a little bit for saying anyone who doesn't want police in their neighborhood, just send them to my neighborhood. And frankly, every other neighborhood in the country. And I live in a neighborhood that I'm fortunate to live in. I don't know of any neighborhood in America that does not want police there. Two, defund, I mean, this bail reform, judge, you are right. Those were -- they were well-intentioned people wanting some form of bail reform, but it has gone awry and it's not -- whatever the good intentions were, they have completely missed the point here and you're putting criminals and violent people back out on the streets. We got to change that. Three, I'm still a believer in the ghost guns. Trey Gowdy and I, we were on last night, Jesse and I were on Brett's show last night talking a little bit about this. You've got to increase the prosecutions of people who have guns illegally. But at the same time you have to ask the question, and you got on me by talking about fresh apples last week, people, some of these kids can get fresh apples but they can get guns. How do they get the guns? If you can't -- if a criminal can't walk into a gun show or gun store and buy it, it seems strange to me these kids have been flood into their community. So, let's go after the bad guys who are flooding it to the communities, guns into these communities, and go after these kids, these thugs and these criminals. Not just kids, any age person committing violent acts in communities, and then let's stop them from getting out of jail and I would agree with you.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but gun trafficking and prosecuting gun trafficking is nothing new. We've been doing it for years. The prosecutors are not doing it now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Something else changed.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's the problem.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: But prior to the pandemic, Chicago had these issues before. Prior to President Trump raising these issues about gun violence in Chicago, it has existed. We also had Democratic mayors who oversaw cities where crime was coming down. A number of reasons, number of factors and we can debate that later, but I think we go after those who are flooding communities with guns also.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, nothing to debate in Chicago. They were one of the lowest in terms of prosecuting gun trafficking in the country.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: I would agree. That needs to change.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, Jesse, this is like age-old lesson that you don't know what you have until it's gone. And we notice that that people like the squad or the loudest defunders.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you think they've learned a lesson?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The defund the police movement disappeared faster than occupy Wall Street. Where they go? I don't hear them chanting. They're not booked on CNN anymore and that's because the defund the police movement caused black lives. And all the people in the media that sponsored it have to live with that. Do you remember in 2020, the people that were pushing defund the police? Who was it? It was the professional black activist class, academic revolutionaries. It was the squad and it was local city council members. Who wasn't on that list? It wasn't your mom and your dad in the black community that struggles with violence. This was not a movement for the people because the people in these neighborhoods know you have to have fast 911 response times. So it took Al Sharpton, who is supposed to represent black America, until September to come out and say that defund the police is something that a latte liberal would support. It took CNN until August to come and say after the polling switch, "Hey, maybe this isn't such a good idea." So, you said, public safety is so fragile. And the minute you pull back and start acting permissive, you get a crime wave and now we are living in the results of that.

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: In fairness to Sharpton, he came out a little sooner, but there is no doubt, there were certainly should've been more voices as well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. And remember, when we brought up defunding, the other networks were saying no, it's not defunding. They're just -- it's diverting. Remember the diverting?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Re-imagining.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, yes, yes. It's not really what it is! CNN still got to answer for that one. And the socialist speak, Bernie Sanders bashes America after the crackdown in communist China.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Socialist darling Bernie Sanders finally breaking his silence on Cuba. And of course he's taking a shot at America. Bernie going soft on the communist regime when pressed on it.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Last year during the campaign you said that it's unfair to simply say everything is bad in Cuba. Do you still share that sentiment now that the people there seem to be --

utterances.speaker: SNE. BERNIE SANDERS (I-VT)
utterances.utterance: Well, I support throughout Latin America and in Cuba and every place else, the right of people to protest for a decent economy and for political freedom.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And Bernie's response wouldn't be complete without blaming America, instead of decades of a communist dictatorship. He tweeted this, "It's also long past time to end the unilateral U.S. embargo on Cuba, which has only hurt, not helped, the Cuban people." Okay, I'll go to you, Greg. Okay, talk about the fact that the people in Cuba who are protesting allegedly are protesting over COVID, according to the Cuban --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Cuban -- what is it?

utterances.speaker: FORD
utterances.utterance: Services?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The services, whatever, the government. Is it really about COVID?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, of course not. COVID just brings out the worst in a doomed society. But for Sanders, it's hard to condemn something or an idea that you've praised for almost your entire life. It goes back to the enemy of intellectual growth, which is the sunk cost. If you've invested 70 years of your life in an idea that destroys entities once they adopt it, it's kind of hard. It's a little late for Bernie to turn that truck around. I mean, it is the ideological equivalent of a money pit. You can't stop putting money to it. Bernie denouncing Cuba would be like CNN denouncing fake news. That's your brand. Jesse denouncing hair gel, you know, Dana denouncing Jasper, me denouncing raw sensuality.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That was a great answer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. You know, the Democratic Socialists of America seem to be backing, you know, the claim that they are over there not protesting about freedom, but they are protesting about other things like the economy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, then they should take Spanish class, because libertad, which is what they are all clamoring for means liberty and freedom, and that's what they are asking for. Actually, if you do just a little bit of research on it for those socialists out there, you can see that it was really from the grassroots and it really show with a lot of artist including a rap artist who was like, "I'm just going to go forward" because they are sick of it. They are tired of it and they want the help. And I don't think that -- well, the good news is for the Cubans, that Bernie is not Biden and Biden is the president of the United States. I don't think that Biden is exactly where Obama was on this. Remember, Obama went like full normalize relations and the embargo, do all these things. President Trump walks it back. I don't think Biden will actually go back to the Obama version because one, they saw what happened when they squashed or didn't help the revolution in Iran. And they don't want that to happen here in Cuba. Like you can't do that to people there. The discouraging thing is that the internet has been shut down and communication has kind of stopped there, so if there's anyone out there that has the technology that would allow these people to be able to communicate with each other, it's good. The other bad news is apparently a lot of these dissidents that were jailed are being treated terribly and there ought to be consequences for that, too.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, Jesse, it's true. They are being treated terribly. And we just found out that there are more than 100 missing or arrested and one included a journalist. You know, what should we be doing in this situation?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, we don't have a great track record of dealing with that regime, so I don't know what we could do. And every attempt we've made to overthrow that regime has backfired. So, I think this might be a time where you want to wait it out. But I want to talk about Bernie Sanders here. Just a little history lesson. The reason we have the embargo against Cuba is because the Soviets put missiles in Cuba, ballistic missiles pointed at the United States. They're 90 miles off the shore of Key West. He just think that's OK. Like, let's just drop the embargo, and all of the enemies of America just send missiles to Cuba and point it at Washington D.C. That's why Bernie Sanders is dangerously stupid. Does Bernie really believe that communism would work if we just dropped the embargo? No, the regime is just going to pilfer all the stuff. And they're going to basically use patronage to set up a permanent and never-ending authoritarian regime. Here's what Bernie, and this is to Greg's point here, here's what Bernie is saying. He never actually addresses the fact that people in these communist countries hated their suffering. He never talks about that. He always talks about theoretical communism and theoretical socialism. And that's because he's arrogant. And he believes that communism or socialism would work in this country. And people would like it if just Bernie Sanders could administer it. And that's the fallacy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. And he actually said it was working in Venezuela until it wasn't. Then he had to take it off the Senate Web site. But what about the Squad? The Squad is kind of quiet on this one.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: I can't speak for him. I don't know why. I have not been, President Biden has not been. I agree with everything that's been said. And there's no excuse. You have a decaying, corrupt and communist regime 90 miles off our shore. I think at some level, we got to step back and even ponder that question a bit. But anybody in their right mind can't support what's happening there and has to be supportive to these protesters. To Jesse's point, it may take -- this could be one of those tipping point moments where the people decide they want this. And I think we'd have to decide how we want to be helpful if we could, and if we could be constructive in helping. Finally, if you look at the entire region, right, you look at our entire hemisphere, one of the reasons I believe as much as we spend money in other hemispheres around the globe to try to stabilize things than we should, we spend very little here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's s true.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: And we have to think about -- think about that in a meaningful way. Take Bernie out of it, take the squat out of it, think about it from a foreign policy and national security standpoint.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's a great point. It really is.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know about you but it's getting really hot in here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We'll leave you guys alone.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Coming up, Big Brother on steroids. President Biden is being pressured to read your text messages.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: New concerns of a big brother in privacy in America. The DNC and President Biden's allies are reportedly pressuring phone companies to monitor text messages to stop COVID misinformation. Adding to Politico, these groups are "planning to engage fact-checkers more aggressively and work with SMS carriers to dispel misinformation about vaccines that is sent over social media and text messages. And the FBI is getting some attention over this post on Twitter, urging Americans to monitor "family members and peers to prevent homegrown violent extremism. Wow. Jesse, let me ask you this. If you have a family member whom you think might be engaged in something that that they shouldn't be engaged in, it could create a domestic terrorism challenge to borrow this language.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, his mom.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: How do you -- how do you react to that in light of what --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It worries me because I think my mom is going to narc on me. Mon Tex is going to go to Chris Wray. Christopher, Jesse Watters is listening to the Dan Bongino podcast and he's radicalized. I mean, you just basically turn this country into media matters. You turn a bunch of Americans into narcs who monitor conservatives and get mad that they tell the truth. The other thing that the top part. You know, what makes Democrats and the media things they even know what misinformation is. They've been wrong on everything about the pandemic, the travel ban, the beach closings, the school closings, warp speed, lab leak, mask mandates, hydroxy, and nursing homes. Now, they're going to turn around and fact-check by phone after being wrong on all of that? No.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Judge, what's the standard? I mean, what should -- we obviously know what the standard is in terms of how far we could go. But should government and should a president be concerned about these kinds of things? Is it completely out of bounds? Is it somewhat in bounds? How would you strike the balance?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Look, I think the President shouldn't be concerned about everything that affects the safety of Americans. But this guy is -- I mean, I don't -- you don't want to know what I think. I mean, first of all, he's got people going door to door. I mean, that is reminiscent of a time in history to get people to then, you know, narc on family members. It was like over Thanksgiving, they were saying about COVID. If there are more than six people next door, call the cops, just like you call the cops if your kids were drinking. We got this whole new mentality now that we've got to turn each other in. It's all about divisiveness. It's all about dividing us whether it's racism, or whether it's them against us. What they're doing is they're creating all of these fighting groups that, you know, we're right and they're wrong and we got to turn them in and turn them into criminals. It's not a good place to be in history.

utterances.speaker: FORD JR.
utterances.utterance: Dana and Greg, I'll ask you to both answer. Is it -- I don't know. I have a strong answer about it's right to get the vaccine. Is there -- is it right or wrong about the vaccine?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, here's the thing. I think that whoever came up with the let's reach vaccine skeptics by monitoring their text messages was probably the same genius who came up with the idea that we should go door to door. They don't communicate clearly. I understand their intentions are very good. I think that what Biden and Harris could actually do if they really cared about this issue, a couple of things. One, it's not just conservatives. There are people that are certainly low income, and sometimes like in black communities, in particular, for example. In those states where there's lower vaccinations, you could find both, right? And also younger people, the age group 18 to 29, they're very much the ones that are just like, well, hold on. But if Biden and Harris who were -- they were the original vaccine skeptic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They were -- if they were willing to say -- just imagine like if they were willing to say, we're going to take a moment here everybody to say, we want to get President Trump credit Operation Warp Speed. We want to thank him for the vaccine. I regret what I said as a candidate for President of the United States, and she says it too. I regret it. We were wrong. That was political. The vaccines are good. Like, if they were to do that, that would actually probably carry a lot more weight. The other thing on the FBI thing is that -- so what they're saying is that the carriers now should have to do what Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube are deciding on their own, because we're saying that those are not government entities. So, you're going to ask Verizon, and AT&T, and T Mobile to actually do that. That's -- to me that won't even pass legal muster. Also remember Apple. Apple is the one who wouldn't even share information with the FBI about a terrorist attack.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Exactly, exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, I think this is all sort of like upside down.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You need a court order for it. You would need a court order to do that. But they're just saying, go ahead and do it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But if you are a company, you should demand a court order because you should not do that on your own.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
